recommendations: Amit Kapoor “Prasad joined Paytm Money as a product manager and was later promoted to a strategy & business role. He demonstrated great ability to make data-driven decisions in face of ambiguity. He made significant and lasting contributions to the company by successfully accomplishing major projects. His solution mindset, work ethic and skills make him a valuable asset to any organization.”

Manish Agrawal “Ridiculously efficient at figuring out how to solve problems - That's Prasad. I hired Prasad in 2021 at Paytm Money and he has worked with me across 4 different projects, ranging from developing an innovative investment product to designing a winning communication strategy for our company. Prasad brings a sense of ownership and enthusiasm to his work that is unmatched and is still one of the most grounded team members I have had. He earns my highest recommendation and I am happy to chat with anyone assessing Prasad for professional opportunities.”

projects: [{"title":"Financial decision making under information asymmetry","start_date":"Mar 2017","end_date":"Present","description":"Aimed at studying the impact of information on decision making of individuals• Designed an Excel VBA based real-time dynamic game that offered several different financial choices for the participants• The choices available in the game were proxies for real-life scenarios such job decision, investments, loans and business opportunities• Analyzed the results that displayed that group with information availability outperformed the other by a margin of 40%• Displayed that the absolute best choice wasn't made despite availability of complete information"},{},{"title":"What explains trading volume better","start_date":"Jun 2016","end_date":"Nov 2016","description":"Sponsored by: National Stock Exchange of India Ltd• Analysed the dynamics of stock price returns and trading volume in a time series-cross sectional model of Nifty 50 market • Employed trading volume as investor sentiment proxy to derive a pricing kernel or risk factor to capture the underlying investor sentiment • Analysed the past 7 years' Nifty 50 to understand if such a behavioural/stochastic pricing kernel/risk factor empirically explains (expected) stock returns • Established trading volume equation through linear & fractal analysis capturing investor sentiment via macro & micro-economic factors • The relation established captures 60% of motion of trading volume of a stock with the remainder offset error value at an standard deviation of 6%"},{},{},{"title":"Rural Development Live Project","start_date":"Mar 2016","end_date":"Apr 2016","description":"• Addressed 'Infrastructure & Sanitation'; was awarded best live project by Rural Development Centre, IIT Kharagpur among the 15 participating groups • Designed resource-optimization strategies for implementation, solving the subject issue along with related problems of Employment and Logistics"},{}]

honors_and_awards.title: First Runner Up at Manthan (OYO Rooms Case Study)
honors_and_awards.description: Topic: Analysing the pilgrims from OYO's perspective and strengthening OYO's base in tier-2 cities - Suggested short term and long term changes in OYO's strategies in order to strengthen their base - Collected and analysed primary data of pilgrim travelling and staying patterns and recommended necessary actions

First Prize in Mahindra Case Study
honors_and_awards.description: Topic: Market Analysis of Stern Drives - Analysed the demand of stern drives in India - Analyzed critical success parameters for stern drive to work effectively in Indian markets - Chalked out an entry strategy for Mahindra

honors_and_awards.title: First Runner Up in Archipedia(Archeaological Case Study)
honors_and_awards.description: Topic: Government policies regarding archaeological sites - Analysed the current costs and revenues for Konark Temple - Suggested initiatives and policies that would convert the temple into a revenue generator
